sentence.idiomatic: Let's order food in today.
Home come you order in every day?
The weather is really nice, don't order food in, let's go out and eat.
The portions at this restaurant are very large.
"Family size" packaged products are all super-sized.
What a huge watermelon. It must weigh over five kilograms.
Three dishes for two people is enough.
Is one bag of instant noodles enough for you to eat?
Today I have a good appetite; one bowl of rice isn't enough.
I'm getting married next weekend. You have to come.
You can absolutely not tell him this matter.
It snowed, and the ground is very slippery. By all means, be careful driving.
I'm calculating the number of people who will attend the meeting tomorrow.
I can't calculate it, you do it.
Add it up--how much are these five pairs of socks?
You must have forgotten my birthday, right?
Can you explain the general situation to me?
This clothing is about 500 RMB.
I'm sorry, I'm always troubling you.

word.literal: to get out of the vehicle

sentence.idiomatic: Please let me through, I want to get off.
I've given you trouble, please forgive me.
Hello, I want to order for delivery.
What do you want to eat?
I'll have an order of Kung Pao Chicken, an order of Spicy Tofu, an order of Fish-flavored Shredded Pork. What are the portions like?
They're quite satisfying--definitely enough. Do you want it spicy?
Please make it extra spicy. But, please use less oil, and absolutely do not add any MSG.
All right. Do you want any vegetable dishes or a starch dish?
Stir-fried greens. Do you have dumplings?
Yes. There are ten per order. What filling would you like?
Pork and cabbage. Give me two orders. All right, that's it. What does that come to?
I'll just add it up. All together it's 60 RMB.
How long until you can deliver it?
Approximately half an hour. What is your address?
China Gardens, Building 6, 503. Please use less oil, and don't add MSG.
I know. It will be delivered in half an hour. Goodbye.
